data.value: Data from which to calculate center-of-mass. The masses can either be positive or negative.
. Dimensions must be the same as
Labels for which to calculate centers-of-mass. If not specified, the combined center of mass of all labels greater than zero will be calculated. Only used with

children.type_: int or sequence of ints, optional

data.value: Calculate the center of mass of the values of an array at labels.
Calculation of multiple objects in an image
Negative masses are also accepted, which can occur for example when bias is removed from measured data due to random noise.
If there are division by zero issues, the function does not raise an error but rather issues a RuntimeWarning before returning inf and/or NaN.
